entry.title: The smallest palindrome
entry.content:
Find the smallest palindrome in a given string

A palindrome is a word or a phrase that is the same whether you read it backwards or forwards, for example the word `refer’.

example:
entry.summary:
Find the smallest palindrome in a given string

A palindrome is a word or a phrase that is the same whether you read it backwards or forwards, for example the word `refer’.

entry.title: Quad combination
entry.content:
Given an array of numbers arr and a number S, find 4 different numbers in arr that sum up to S.

Write a function that gets arr and S and returns an array with 4 indices of such numbers in arr, or null if no such combination exists. Explain and code the most efficient solution possible, and analyze its runtime and space complexity.

example:
entry.summary:
Given an array of numbers arr and a number S, find 4 different numbers in arr that sum up to S.

Write a function that gets arr and S and returns an array with 4 indices of such numbers in arr, or null if no such combination exists. Explain and code the most efficient solution possible, and analyze its runtime and space complexity.

entry.title: Smallest substring of all characters
entry.content:
Given an array with unique characters ‘arr’ and a string ‘str’, find the smallest substring of ‘str’ containing all characters of ‘arr’.

example:

entry.title: Flatten nested arrays of integers
entry.content:
Write some code, that will flatten an array of arbitrarily nested arrays of integers into a flat array of integers.

example:
entry.summary:

entry.title: Merging 2 packages
entry.content:
Given a package with a weight limit and an array of item weights, how can you most efficiently find two items with sum of weights that equals the weight limit?

Your function should return 2 such indices of item weights or -1 if such pair doesn’t exist. What is the runtime and space complexity of your solution?

example:
entry.summary:

Your function should return 2 such indices of item weights or -1 if such pair doesn’t exist. What is the runtime and space complexity of your solution?

entry.title: Reorder an array with given indexes
entry.content:
We have an array of objects A and an array of indexes B. Reorder objects in array A with given indexes in array B. Do not change array A’s length.

example:

entry.title: Pascal's triangle
entry.content:
Write a function to return the nth row in Pascal’s triangle

For example,
getRow(1) returns 1
getRow(2) returns 1 1
getRow(3) returns 1 2 1
getRow(4) returns 1 3 3 1
entry.summary:
Write a function to return the nth row in Pascal’s triangle

For example,
getRow(1) returns 1
getRow(2) returns 1 1
getRow(3) returns 1 2 1
getRow(4) returns 1 3 3 1
